p: How does the duration of LPMs closure affect? Many published studies agreed that the government would play a crucial role to implement the policy of LPMs closure timely once a confirmed case has occurred in this city [ 24]. Some even suggested that LPMs should be closed immediately in areas where H7N9 virus is detected in LPMs [ 25]. From a public health standpoint, LPMs should remain closed in all affected areas until the current influenza A (H7N9) epizootic and epidemic are declared definitively over by national authorities [ 8]. Moreover, one study suggested that A (H7N9) virus activity peaked around March in both retail and wholesale LPMs, while A (H5N1) virus peaked around in December to January in China [ 6]. Based on the evidence of our results, control measures (e.g. LPMs all closure) for avoiding exposure from live poultry to human and surveillance in LPMs should be maintained over spring.
